citeinfo.origin: National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA), Office of Oceanic and Atmospheric Research (OAR), Pacific Marine Environmental Laboratory (PMEL)
citeinfo.title: Confirmation of a Convoluted Flow over the Southeastern Bering Sea Shelf

abstract.p: Data from 16 CTD sections during spring 1979-1981 were used to derive mean geopotential topography and geostrophic flow (and its variability). Inshore of 100 m, there was a weak (~1.5 cm s) but quite stable southeastward flow, with a horizontal extent of at least 60 km. Offshore of 100 m, an even wider northwestward flow of 4-6 cm s was present, with a suggestion of anticyclonic eddies in the region ~20% of the time. Inshore of 100 m, however, eddy activity was quite rare. The main features from the synoptic data are virtually identical to those in a recent study using spatially averaged climatological data.
[ Reference: Reed, R.K. (1998): Confirmation of a convoluted flow over the southeastern Bering Sea shelf. Cont. Shelf. Res., 18, 99 - 103. ]

descript.purpose: A report showing the confirmation of a convoluted flow over the southeastern Bering Sea shelf
